Examples: Tiamat emerges into the world. The Storm King isn't found/rescued. Vox Machina do not defeat Vecna. These are pretty big events to fail and have realm-wide consequences. I ask because I'd be super interested to see/hear that work.

Do DMs play through campaign fail-states in 5e (non-TPK)? Seems, at least on the surface, that people champion the completion of an adventure but I've never heard of catastrophic failure and moving forward with the story of that.
@NoeRangel @cartoonbrew At least.

@nTs_qpop @Bartoneus Also, assume, as well that the Dungeon moves without you (to pull Fronts from Dungeon World) so as the players explore - the dungeon ecosystem moves forward with it's own "life". Something "Temple of the Elemental Evil" introduced to mixed results but Caves of Chaos did well

@nTs_qpop @Bartoneus Said another way - Combat shouldn't be the only crayon available in the box for the Players; and I think that, from a design and DM standpoint, this is an important consideration in any situation.

@mercyfuldm Let us know if that worked.

@mercyfuldm If it's your washer, in suite, I would suspect there is something in the washer still in which case, Flush the washer, at its hottest setting without any clothes, and 1 qt. of bleach. Rerun it again with 1 qt. vinegar. to flush out the powder from machine/pipes.

@mercyfuldm I would try this. Buy one of those Oxyclean powder containers and buy or find a sample of a NEW pod/detergent (pref. liquid) and re-run just the blacks through to see if the white marks vanish.
@mercyfuldm Could be. Other problems would be a shared laundry room in the building where someone used powder and there is powder residue left in the washer that is marking the clothes.
@mercyfuldm and yeah, definitely separate your laundry.
@mercyfuldm Do you use a white deodorant?
@mercyfuldm could be detergent (if powder) or fabric softener.

@Bartoneus It's an old / OSR way of looking at playing the world; a dungeon was treated as a sandbox with boundaries. Every TTRPG should be "play to find out what happens".
